doc.after: PiratbyrÃ¥n proposed, and published most of its work under, a copyright alternative called kopimi (pronounced, and sometimes also spelled "copyme").[17] Designed to be the opposite of copyright, a kopimi notice specifically encourages that the work be copiedâfor any purpose, commercial or non-commercial.[18] Kopimi is similar to the CC0 license created by Creative Commons,[citation needed] although Kopimi adds a positive imperative for others to copy.
